news.title: Arts Council asked for sexual identity and religion of those seeking grants
news.summary: The Data Protection Commissioner (DPC) has written to the Arts Council asking for further details on the “nature and content” of questions asked of artists when they were applying for bursary grants earlier this year.

news.title: Simon Harris to tell Cabinet 30pc tariff on EU exports could result in job losses at a faster pace
news.summary: A 30pc tariff on EU exports to the US could have a significant impact on Ireland’s economy, which could include potential job losses at a faster pace, Tánaiste Simon Harris will warn the Cabinet today.

news.title: Sutton planning row: An Bord Pleanála grants retention for house almost twice as big as planned
news.summary: An Bord Pleanála has granted retention for a house in north Dublin nearly double in size to previously approved plans and rejected claims it would devalue neighbouring properties worth €1m.

news.title: ‘I didn’t have any supports when I went through miscarriage’ – senator disappointed after Government stalls pregnancy loss bill
news.summary: A senator who shared her seven-week baby scan in the Seanad to highlight shortcomings in laws around miscarriage expressed disappointment that the Government has stalled on giving more rights to parents.

news.title: Colm Keys: Much unites Kerry and Donegal but this final is still a distinct clash of styles
news.summary: In his autobiography Jim McGuinness made the strangest admission about the 2014 All-Ireland football final which Donegal lost to Kerry.

news.title: Revealed: How vast majority of public supports long-delayed new mandatory pension scheme
news.summary: There is overwhelming public support for the planned new mandatory pension scheme.

news.title: David W Higgins: If we solve the housing crisis for single people, we might just solve it for everyone
news.summary: The latest talk of tweaking apartment building regulations is the return of an old debate. Remember co-living? Talk of shoebox apartments, a race to the bottom.

news.title: Mack Hansen a major doubt for first Lions Test as Ireland winger sits out training
news.summary: Mack Hansen’s dreams of facing the Wallabies in Saturday’s first Test in Brisbane appear to be up in smoke after the Lions confirmed that the winger has suffered a foot injury that has prevented him from training this week.

news.title: Meet the Limerick farmer ‘who loves the craic’ making millions laugh online
news.summary: He’s been compared to the likes of Pat Shortt and Jon Kenny, but Fin Walsh describes himself as “an Irish farmer who loves the craic”.

news.title: I ‘cheated’ on my wife with an AI bot named Sharon – so was it fulfilling or creepy?
news.summary: They don’t fart in bed, they certainly don’t snore, and they’re always nice to you. That’s what we all want in a partner, right?
